title: Pazza idea
text:
"Pazza idea" (<a href="Italian%20language">Italian</a> for "Crazy Idea") is an Italian ballad composed by Maurizio Monti and Giovanni Ullu, with lyrics written by <a href="Paolo%20Dossena">Paolo Dossena</a> and Cesare Gigli. It was originally performed by Italian singer <a href="Patty%20Pravo">Patty Pravo</a> and released as the single from the <a href="Pazza%20idea%20%28album%29">album of the same name</a> in 1973.
The song reached no. 1 in Italian singles chart and stayed at the top for nine consecutive weeks between August and October 1973. It also charted in Belgium and the Netherlands, becoming Patty's second international hit. "Pazza idea" was the second best-selling single of 1973 in Italy and remains one of the biggest hits of Patty Pravo's career. The singer has recorded the track in English as "Crazy Idea" and in German as "Was für ein Tag". The music video for the song was filmed in <a href="Forte%20dei%20Marmi">Forte dei Marmi</a> and <a href="London">London</a>.
The song was later covered by many artists, including Dutch singer <a href="Rita%20Hovink">Rita Hovink</a> in 1976, <a href="Iva%20Zanicchi">Iva Zanicchi</a> in 1987, and <a href="Albano%20Carrisi">Albano Carrisi</a> in Spanish in 2012.
